channel.name: Is it possible to serialize the SmartContract transaction after signing but before proving?

messages.content: Yes, you can serialize txn with `tx.toJSON()` , deserialize with `Mina.Transaction.fromJSON(JSON.parse(json))`and you need to recreate the `lazyAuthorization` field on each account update.
yeah but recreating `lazyAuthorization` is tricky. it contains all the method inputs for proving
in the future I want to make `Mina.transaction` already create the witness, so `prove()` receives something which can be serialized easily and doesn't need to run the JS method code
would be good for outsourcing

It is an essential feature for user UI as it will enable to skip compiling and proving in the user interface and will make the UI interface 1000x faster and user memory requirements 10x smaller.
@gregor is it difficult to make Mina.transaction create the witness and serialize it for prove()?
@DFST it's not a trivial task because currently witness generation and proving are both mashed together in one function that's in pickles
but conceptually it's not difficult, just annoying with all the comlpicated types in pickles and the complicated process to update something deep in our stack
Can you please put it on the o1js roadmap? Given the lighting speed with which the o1js team is working, I think that we will be able to make great zkApps with this feature quite soon)))
I just posted this idea and a link to our conversation in a relevant internal channel 🙂
Great, thanks a lot!
But isn’t compiling and proving performed before signing?
No, it is not necessary. You can see an example above.

Okay, I find the returned result of signedTx to be directly changed and send again. Will this not affect signature authentication?

https://github.com/dfstio/minanft-lib/blob/master/experimental/proving.prove.v2.test.ts#L32

embeds.title: minanft-lib/experimental/proving.prove.v2.test.ts at master · dfsti...
embeds.description: MinaNFT TypeScript/JavaScript integration library. Contribute to dfstio/minanft-lib development by creating an account on GitHub.

messages.content:
The signature authentication will be valid subject to fee, sender, nonce and probably blindingValue be the same (that is guaranteed by the code used). The only thing that is being changed is proof authentication that is being added later to signature authentication.

The txs on devnet are successful with this method:
https://minascan.io/devnet/account/B62qphWWs8HNBAepakFneJxHB8DSR7641mvDTeWftApZTrxtA9oDFST/txs?type=zk-acc

But except for sender, fee, and nonce, will it not be affected if other parameters of zkApp are modified?
For example, if I plan to transfer 1 NFT, can I change the quantity to 2 and then send it directly without sign again (because no signature is required in the middle)?
That's a great idea, just wanted to confirm the specifics

It's depends upon the SmartContract design, but with well-designed SmartContract is should be impossible.

Internally, tx consists of many Account Updates, being confirmed by signature, proof or none authentication:
https://docs.minaprotocol.com/zkapps/o1js/permissions#types-of-authorizations

For the specific tx, there can be for example 2 signatures. The typical example is deploying the contract, where we need the signature of the fee payer and the signature by the private key of the account where the zkApp is being deployed:
https://github.com/dfstio/minanft-lib/blob/master/experimental/proving.deploy.test.ts#L30

In case we need to guarantee that the specific operation is confirmed by the user, we can give the signature of the user as the input to the SmartContract method. In this case, Auro Wallet will be called two times by the web zkApp: first time to create a signature of operation like selling the NFT, and the second time to sign the tx (mainly for fee payment reason), for example
https://github.com/dfstio/minanft-lib/blob/master/experimental/payment.test.ts#L98
Okay, we will check this feature, and if there is any new progress, we will post it here.
Thanks a lot!

One more question: you're speaking about creating the witness so the prover can use just the witness to calculate the proof. The prover still needs to compile the SmartContract and have the SmartContract code. 

If we're talking about refactoring the pickles code, is it possible to include creating a fully serializable prover (similar to .zkey in Circom) into the scope?

It will allow for creating a proof market, where the proof workers will run only general-purpose provers without the need to compile or even have the SmartContract code. For calculating the proof for a specific SmartContract/ZkProgram, provers will need two files: witness (different for each tx) and serialized prover (stays the same, so can be downloaded by the prover once). 

As additional benefit, this will allow not to use JavaScript for proving and run the prover in OCaml that will speed-up proving significantly (this will also solve this [request for OCaml](https://minaprotocol.com/blog/recursive-zkrollups-hazook)).
That's a good point, the prover should not need the smart contract code which means some additional light refactoring will be needed so that cached compile also doesn't need it
We would probably expose a native ocaml prover to o1js, since we want that for other use cases anyway

Those are great news; thank you @gregor  for this. Then we should then put the prover in a cryptographically secure enclave environment in the cloud, ensure that the witness is encrypted during transport, and—voilà—we have the fastest and most secure zkApps in the world on the Mina protocol!
You lose the hiding properties though. The prover will always know the data you are proving upon, bcs you can't encrypt the witness directly
It is solved by using cryptographically secure enclave environment
But I like being able to operate on the compiled circuit directly
I am not familiar with that, any resources you can share to read up on that?

You can see for example
https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/nitro/nitro-enclaves/
https://docs.marlin.org/learn/kalypso/architecture#5-oyster-environment
Thanks!
You are on fire @DFST

Hi @here! Update:

Now it is possible to sign zkApp tx in the browser before compiling and proving thanks to the great work by @bulingTang | Auro Wallet 

You can test it at https://minanft.io/sign
It takes 1328 ms to create a transaction and present it for the signature to the user.

When you enter the number and press Sign, first zkApp tx is created and signed with Auro Wallet (the SmartContract is not compiled at this stage), and only then is the SmartContract compiled, tx proved, and sent to the network. You can see the process on the console and the resulting txs on https://minascan.io/devnet/account/B62qk7nXjEzGJdyQFNVs5UauASTQJgiJSBpHJmDcFTiYQrDDTGDsNFT/txs?type=zk-acc
The memo field is the value you entered in the form.

For it to work, you should upgrade Auro Wallet to the latest version 2.2.16
The test code: https://github.com/dfstio/minanftio/blob/minanft/src/routes/Sign/contract.js

Example with the compiling and proving in the cloud:
https://minanft.io/cloud

In this example, no compiling or proving happens in the web browser. zkApp tx is prepared and signed in the web browser, then sent to the cloud where it is being deserialized, the contract is compiled, and the tx is proved and sent. Then, the cloud returns to the web browser tx hash.
